title: Dongguan Hanji
description: "...and in rode the Orange Cavalry, seeking to arrest the lawbreaker."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_authority_common_unlock}}

title: Huainanzi
description: "If appropriate personnel are appointed, then the realm is well-governed."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_authority_exceptional_unlock}}

title: Records of the Grand Historian
description: "I myself have travelled west as far as Kongtong, north past Zhuolu, east to the sea, and in the south I have sailed the Yellow and Huai rivers."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_authority_refined_unlock}}

title: The Book of Lord Shang
description: The law is an expression of love for the people.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_authority_unique_unlock}}

title: Book of Changes
description: The topmost line, divided, shows its subject, amidst the startling movements, in breathless dismay and looking round him with trembling apprehension. If he takes action, there will be evil.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_cunning_common_unlock}}

title: The Writings on Reckoning
description: This treatise represents the true authority on mathematics; from fractions to factorisation.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_cunning_exceptional_unlock}}

title: Classic of Poetry
description: "With volume vast, the waters flow, but still within their channel run."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_cunning_refined_unlock}}

title: Book of Rites
description: "When sitting by a person of rank, if he began to yawn and stretch himself, to turn round his tablet, to play with the head of his sword, to move his shoes about, or to ask about the time of day, one might ask leave to retire."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_cunning_unique_unlock}}

title: Huangdi Neijing
description: "One should use all five examinations and combine their results, then one will be able to decide upon the share of life and death."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_authority_common_unlock}}

title: Discourses on Salt & Iron
description: "Our ancestors spurned avarice and honoured righteousness; they venerated integrity and cared not for wealth."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_expertise_exceptional_unlock}}

title: Nan Jing
description: While the Huangdi Neijing may be authoritative, this book aims to clarify some of the vaguer areas.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_expertise_refined_unlock}}

title: Chu Ci
description: "Long, long had been my road and far, far was the journey; I would go up and down to seek my heart's desire."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_expertise_unique_unlock}}

title: Wei Liaozi
description: "If the land is vast and properly used, then the realm is wealthy; if the population is large and properly controlled, then the realm is well-governed."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_instinct_common_unlock}}

title: The Six Secret Teachings
description: "If you can attain complete victory without fighting, without the great army suffering any losses, you will have penetrated even the realm of ghosts and spirits."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_instinct_exceptional_unlock}}

title: The Three Strategies of Huang Shigong
description: "If the general's plans are confidential, treacherous minds are prevented; if the troops are unified, morale is consolidated; if attacks are swift, their preparation will not be in time."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_instinct_refined_unlock}}

title: The Art of War
description: "If in training soldiers' commands are habitually enforced, the army will be well-disciplined; if not, its discipline will be bad."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_instinct_unique_unlock}}

title: Zuo Zhuan
description: "Xu Chen, having cloaked his horses in tiger skins, led the attack by striking directly at the troops of Chen and Cai."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_resolve_common_unlock}}

title: Classic of Mountains & Seas
description: "There is a beast dwelling here, whose form resembles a horse but with a white body, black tail, a single horn and tiger's teeth and claws!"\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_resolve_exceptional_unlock}}

title: Lüshi Chunqiu
description: An almanac of miscellaneous information, especially pertaining to agriculture.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_resolve_refined_unlock}}

title: Mencius
description: "Men, for the most part, err and are afterwards able to reform."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_great_library_resolve_unique_unlock}}

title: Nushe Bifa
description: "Do I know archery?! My good fellow, I wrote the book on it!"\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_heroes_unique_unlock}}

title: Imperial Banner
description: "Granted me by the emperor himself!"\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_melee_cav_common_unlock}}

title: Silk Belt
description: "Given to me by a warrior I defeated in single combat."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_melee_cav_refined_unlock}}

title: Bronze Double-cup
description: "I wondered where I'd put that!"\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_melee_cav_unique_unlock}}

title: Yellow Turban Banner
description: A good reminder that one must respect the people always.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_melee_inf_common_unlock}}

title: Silk Headdress
description: They fought bravely, to the end.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_melee_inf_refined_unlock}}

title: Bronze Boshanlu
description: One who is calm fears not the arrows of their enemies\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_melee_inf_unique_unlock}}

title: Worn Sandals
description: It is important to offer safe haven to those who do not seek war.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_people_unique_unlock}}

title: Black Dragon Siyah Bow
description: "I won this in a competition with a wandering archer in the Jade Gate Pass."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_ranged_common_unlock}}

title: Wicker Bales
description: "They may not look like much, but they saved me in a pinch when I dived behind them!"\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_ranged_refined_unlock}}

title: Ornate Quiver
description: "Its former owner wasn't going to need it anymore..."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_ranged_unique_unlock}}

title: Chen Banner
description: Quite possibly the finest men I have yet had the pleasure of meeting.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_shock_cav_common_unlock}}

title: Silk Robe
description: The finest silks, depicting a great battle.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_shock_cav_refined_unlock}}

title: Amber Steppe Horseman
description: "They ride without saddles and are able to fire behind them while they do so! Luckily, I ducked."\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_shock_cav_unique_unlock}}

title: Bronze Winch Mechanism
description: Crafted by the finest artisans in the bustling workshops of the capital.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_siege_common_unlock}}

title: Reclaimed Siege Engine
description: Some assembly required…\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_siege_refined_unlock}}

title: Dented Helmet
description: "I stepped aside at the last moment! It grazed my hat and hit my opponent square in the face - now [[b]]that's[[/b]] providence, my friend!"\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_siege_unique_unlock}}

title: Volunteer Banner
description: Oft-times, it would seem, the greatest heroes come from the humblest beginnings.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_spear_inf_common_unlock}}

title: Silk Tassel
description: "Taken from the very spear which dared pierce my armour!"\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_spear_inf_refined_unlock}}

title: Jade Halberd Blade
description: Jade and men; both are sharpened by bitter tools.\n\n{{tr:3k_dlc04_trophy_cabinet_spear_inf_unique_unlock}}

title: Complete Confucian
description: "In literature, perhaps I am equal to others. But I cannot manifest the behaviour of the noble man."

title: The Loyal Barbarian
description: Ironically, this one has proven anything but loyal by raising his standard against the emperor.

title: Architect of the Southern Palace
description: "Once complete, the Anterior Pavillion will be a delight to behold – it'll even have a water feature!"

title: Aspiring Official
description: He who aspires to greater personal advancement tends to be more... 'morally flexible' than his peers.

title: Marshal of Men
description: Some people are born to lead others… and preferably from the very front, as an example to their followers.

title: Ritual Master
description: This one knows every aspect of the procedures he has been tasked with administrating, becoming a master in his chosen field.

title: Loyal Son
description: The offspring of Cao Song has remained loyal to his family through thick and thin.

title: Ambitious Tycoon
description: For the determined entrepreneur, no price is too high for the acquisition of real, workable power.

title: Man For All Seasons
description: Sometimes, just sometimes, power fails to corrupt, and instead leads to altruism and charity.

title: Abundant Talent
description: This man's gifts were noted at a young age and he continues to blossom, as if perpetually held in spring's sweet bloom.

title: Living Legacy
description: You can call it inherited ability or mere nepotism, depending on the level of your cynicism.

title: Unscrupulous Advisor
description: Everything has a price it seems.

title: Deadly Beauty
description: Diao Chan uses her enchanting beauty to hide her ambition; one which can topple tyrants.

title: Rising Dragon
description: This one is going places - specifically, up in the cut-throat world of Imperial administration.

title: Honest & Fair
description: This man is admired for his honest, plain-speaking ways and even-handed manner in all things.

title: Model Governor
description: This one understands when to use the velvet glove and when to reveal the iron hand beneath.

title: Enforcer
description: "I've heard that bandits have been abroad around these parts recently. Me? No, I know nothing about such things..."

title: The Inconstant Emperor
description: He who flits and fluctuates risks appearing inconsistent, unsteady and, eventually, unstable...

title: The Great Emperor of the Han
description: Having overcome adversity, this one is now recognised as a great emperor of the Han.

title: Lord Shi
description: Due to fears for his health, Liu Bian was raised away from the capital by the famed Taoist, Shi Zimiao, earning him the nickname 'Lord Shi'.

title: Subtle Manipulator
description: Always plotting, always scheming, always something beneath the obvious. Always.

title: Bitter Adversary
description: "In another life, they could've been best friends. However, that's just not how the bones fell…"

title: Destroyer of Rebels
description: Fu Xie is not only a general of no little repute – the scourge of the Yellow Turbans, perhaps – but also a skilled writer.

title: Officer for Medicines
description: "After a thorough examination, I've decided the best way forward is a course of leeches."

title: Budding Scholar
description: An up-and-coming young mind, of which great things are expected.

title: Determined Sapper
description: Burrowing under tree and hill, no defences are a match for the mind of a determined sapper.

title: Friend of the He
description: "Do I know the He? Oh yes, we go waaaaay back. I could tell you stories..."

title: White Wave Veteran
description: Many battles – and many lives – have passed before the eyes of this grizzled bandit.

title: The Butcher of the He
description: The axe that cleaves through beast can so easily be turned to rend man too.

title: Modest & Stalwart
description: This one's unwavering loyalty is matched only by their demure nature.

title: Scion of Gold
description: Not all that glitters is gold. Sometimes, talent shines even brighter.

title: Arbiter of the Planets
description: To decide between two astronomical methods is a most difficult and perplexing conundrum, but the emperor must have his forecast.

title: The Nightingale
description: Even the morningsong that drifts on the wind cannot compare to the sweet lyric of the muse.

title: Daughter of the Southlands
description: The south produces boons to its nobles: two daughters, fair of mind and strong of resolve.

title: Ever-faithful
description: To support one another, through both the fruitful times and the barren, is the essence of marriage.

title: Daughter of the Southlands
description: To the filial and the devout, life will give not one, but two measures of its respect.

title: Creeping Dread
description: Death personified; the slow knife that appears, unexpected and lethal.

title: Prince of Chen
description: Liu Chong is not the heir apparent, but is the prince most active and beloved by his people.

title: Mathematical Sage
description: What this one can do with numbers is impressive, exciting, and almost a little worrying…

title: Wanderer
description: "There is much to be learned in every town, every port, and from every person you encounter, friend."

title: Lord Dong
description: Though he officially retired from political life some time ago, the empress-dowager still has a care for Lord Dong and his views.

title: Trusting Warlord
description: It is the curse of the trusting to be magnanimous, generous, and ultimately tricked.

title: Gracious Host
description: "Come in, my friend, come in! Tea, perhaps? Or something stronger…?"

title: Stargazer
description: The stars paint a picture on the canvas of night, mesmerising and beautiful.

title: Gentleman Cadet
description: If one wishes to learn the intricacies of gentlemanly behaviour, one need look no further.

title: Paragon of Governance
description: Being born to a vast family can feed either vice or virtue. Luckily, this one is kind to a fault, but it could've gone either way.

title: Judge of Talent
description: "Yes yes, we will bring you before them, and they will know. They ALWAYS know…"

title: Respected Mentor
description: A peerless teacher and favoured friend, though chronically misfortunate.

title: Guardian of the People
description: "There is nothing to be gained from oppressing the people; they, ultimately, will decide our fate."

title: Penniless Knight
description: From town to town, they speak of this one's deeds, yet the warrior himself remains a wandering mystery.

title: Counsellor Remonstrant
description: Wisdoms pours from every word of this able, if inexperienced, counsellor.

title: Hippophobe
description: A psychological fear of horses is not entirely unreasonable when you've seen what they can do.

title: Loyalist of the Han
description: Against all odds, to whatever end, they will defend the Han.

title: Harbinger of Chaos
description: This one has seen the way the world is going. Tumult is imminent.

title: Architect of the Jade Hall
description: Emperor Shun's hall was a thing of unbridled splendour, but has fallen into some disrepair. This man has been tasked with its maintenance.

title: Lord of the Sources
description: Like the river flows, so too does the blood of his enemies.

title: Eyes & Ears
description: Amongst so many advisors, who would suspect one more…?

title: Cruel Turncoat
description: Honour is nothing to those for whom gold and glory loom large over all.

title: Seeker of Talent
description: "I see in you the ability to…. Yes, yes! Something FAR greater…"

title: Financial Genius
description: Having mastered finance's decidedly black arts, this one is able to generate funds almost from thin air.

title: Pirate of the Thousand Sails
description: This pirate rides with an armada at his back and the call to glory in his soul!

title: Fighter Against Corruption
description: This one seeks unscrupulous dishonesty wherever it may lurk. It will be rooted out.

title: Bookish Scholar
description: The words of these tomes take the reader to another world, if only temporarily…

title: Master of Ceremonies
description: "My lords, my lords! Please attend carefully!"

title: Chess Grandmaster
description: "Typically, however, the winner is just the player who made the penultimate mistake."

title: Loyal Yuan
description: Loyalty to family above all.

title: General of the Land
description: Zhang Bao nourishes the land with the blood of the undeserving.

title: General of Heaven
description: Zhang Jue leads the Yellow Rebellion, driven by divine purpose!

title: General of the People

title: Scourge of Nanyang
description: Peasants speak of this one in hushed whispers, whilst those of Nanyang howl in anguish.

title: Imperial Father
description: Though they share no blood, this man has been like a father to the emperor.

title: Peerless Protégé
description: If there is a task to perform, this one will see it done.

title: The Turtle
description: "Behold, you assault the Turtle! Nothing shall pierce my shell!"

title: Imperial Mother
description: Though they are unrelated, this man has been as a mother to the emperor.

title: Nominator of Worth
description: Truly, this one can see if two people will fit together, and if they will not.

title: Frontline General
description: "I am one of you, I know your pain!"

title: Auxiliary Leader
description: "I won't be the one to refuse good warriors, no matter where you hail from!"

title: Assassin
description: After a few kills, a degree of finesse is developed; after a few more, death is just routine.

title: Avenger
description: "You really shouldn't have killed my uncle."

title: Bandit
description: "Life isn't fair. It's just fairer than death, that's all."

title: Brute
description: Niceties, wordplay, in fact, anything other than the coarsest violence is alien to this one.

title: Charlatan
description: Don’t believe a word! This person is not who they first appear to be…

title: Demagogue
description: Rationality be damned! The ability to appeal to the rabble's basest views, no matter how wrong-headed, tends to get the desired result.

title: Disgraced Noble
description: "I can never return, of course, not until I have redeemed myself."

title: Embezzler
description: Funds have been… misplaced, and this one is flagrantly, obviously, blatantly the guilty party.

title: Enforcer
description: You can get a lot further in life with a kind word and a visible blade than you can with just a kind word.

title: Escaped Convict
description: Having escaped custody and a punishment most-severe, this one is on the run, with little or nothing to lose.

title: Fugitive Officer
description: "I didn't kill my wife!"

title: Hermit
description: To find one who does not wish to be found is an impressive, if not confounding, feat.

title: Magician
description: These scarcely believable feats are no mere acts of trickery, although such acts are themselves also surprisingly difficult.

title: Mastermind
description: "I've started, so I'll finish…"

title: Murderer
description: When it comes to getting what they want, this person is not above the lowest, basest act one can commit…

title: Pillager
description: "What's yours is mine. What's theirs is mine. It's all mine, essentially."

title: Poacher
description: "Clever girl…"

title: Ringleader
description: The ability to galvanise others to a cause can be both blessing and curse; regardless, when this one speaks, others listen keenly, and act.

title: Rogue
description: A flash of their wry smile is almost enough to forgive them their terrible deeds. Almost.

title: Saboteur
description: "What you do afterwards is not my concern. That is somebody else's job."

title: Thief
description: This one is a bit… Put it this way: you'd best nail down what you want to hang on to.

title: Town Drunk
description: This one can't leave the bottle alone, nor put it down once they've picked it up; not really a suitable candidate – for anything!

title: Tribal Exile
description: Cast out by their own people, this one is has left their own lands by necessity as much as a sense of adventure.

title: Trickster
description: This person always has a hidden agenda; do not trust them any further than you can throw them!

title: Wanderer
description: "I have walked my way since the beginning. Sometimes I give, sometimes I take – it is mine to know which and when."

title: Loyal Sharpshooter
description: Potential traitors should keep an eye out for Cao Xing... or risk losing it!

title: Magistrate
description: An important cog of law administration, who is no stranger to the pressures of bureaucracy.

title: Elder Cheng
description: Cheng Pu's experience and wisdom makes him a pillar of stability.

title: Ruthless Pragmatist
description: Cheng Yu knows that even the most unthinkable actions can become unavoidable in times of war.

title: Drunken Incompetent
description: Whatever Chunyu Qiong suggests, do the opposite.

title: Legendary Beauty
description: Some men will throw themselves into terrible danger in search of Diaochan's favour, and some would consider committing the blackest of crimes…

title: Formation Breaker
description: The enemy will break. Gao Shun will not.

title: Paranoid Thug
description: Guo Si has many real enemies – and many more imagined ones!

title: Erratic Advisor
description: Guo Tu's advice is always the same: attack!

title: Loyal Mercenary
description: Han Dang's modus operandi has often been compared to that of a mercenary. His loyalty and dedication to his masters is unwavering, however.

title: Feeder of Armies
description: A courageous warrior and an adept agriculturalist, Han Hao is a valuable asset.

title: Treacherous Rogue
description: He'll stab you in the back as soon as he gets the chance, but until then Hao Meng's dirty tricks can be most useful.

title: Blunt Instrument
description: Ji Ling believes most problems can be solved through the overwhelming application of brute force.

title: Voice of Reason
description: Ju Shou knows the risks of haste and the value of patience.

title: Humble Matriarch
description: It takes patience and wisdom to manage the fractious brood that is the Cao family.

title: Steadfast Loyalist
description: Lady Mi will do anything to protect her family – even if it means sacrificing herself.

title: Vicious Strongman
description: In Li Jue's view, politics is just the continuation of war by other means.

title: Mengmei Householder
description: Lou Gui will summon fortifications from the air itself,  but he expects to be rewarded…

title: Daughter of the Dragon
description: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree. Lü Bu's daughter is as beautiful as she is deadly.

title: Enforcer of Morals
description: Who watches the watchmen? In this case, Mao Jie.

title: Vindictive Sneak
description: Ruthlessly competitive, Pang Ji will employ whatever dirty trick he can to come out on top.

title: The Dependable
description: When everyone else is losing their heads, Shen Pei can be trusted to keep things going.

title: Forthright Advisor
description: Tian Feng's advice is usually good – though it's not always what people want to hear...

title: Astute Analyst
description: Few can dissect a person's character as keenly as Xu Shao.

title: Reformed Vigilante
description: Xu Shu once wandered the lands as a roaming swordsman - but now his mind is his sharpest weapon.

title: Inveterate Schemer
description: "I have a cunning plan..."

title: White Wave Warlord
description: The White Wave warlord reads the tides of time, and his allegiances always lie with those most beneficial to him.

title: Respected Advisor
description: "Your wisdom is without question, but if I could but offer a suggestion…?"

title: Abrasive Advisor
description: Those with sensitive egos should beware of asking advice from Yu Fan.

title: Agricultural Reformer
description: Yuan Huan cares not whom he serves, so long as he can pursue his reformist interests.

title: Unfavoured Son
description: A prestigious lineage can be both a boon and a burden – especially when your father is as ambitious as Yuan Tan's.

title: Crafty Operator
description: Chaos is a ladder, and one Zang Ba is well equipped to climb.

title: Father of the Tuntian
description: Zao Zhi knows that all kingdoms are founded upon two things: the people and the land.

title: Populist Rogue
description: Ze Rong steals from the rich to feed the poor. And himself. Mostly himself.

title: Prince of Black Mountain
description: The son of the 'Flying Swallow' is no less of a man than his father.

title: Adept Diplomat
description: With a quick wit and unflappable demeanour, Zhang Hong moves between courts with consummate ease.

title: Friend to All
description: Zhang Miao has friends everywhere. It's a shame they all hate each other.

title: Reed in the Wind
description: Zhang Xiu's flexibility is an asset when times a good, but keep an eye on him if the tables turn…

title: Stern Advisor
description: Even the mightiest warlords need a sharp rebuke from time to time. Zhang Zhao can be relied upon to provide it.

title: Man of Many Scars
description: His scar-riddled skin is a canvas of stories, telling of countless bloody battles past.

title: Flying Daggers
description: A fan of blades, a spash of blood, an enemy falls once more.

title: Garlic-leaved Fragrance
description: It is said that grinding up this herb will cure many of the sicknesses which plague visitors to the south.

title: Mulu's Bell
description: The sound of the bell, like a peal of thunder, strikes fear into the hearts of the Nanmans' enemies.

title: Diplomat's Chest
description: A chest for a diplomat, filled with treatises and writings.

title: Trader's Chest
description: A chest for a trader, with coin scales and coins from various regions.

title: Commander's Chest
description: A chest for a commander, with martial treatises as well as exquisite military materials.

title: Lord's Chest
description: A chest for a lord, containing the finest of luxuries, fit for a court member of the highest standing.

title: Industrialist's Chest
description: A chest for an industrialist, filled with materials to help boost labour productivity in a region.

description: A chest for an economist, containing tools and guidelines to incentivise a region to generate more profit.

title: Ahuinan's Armour
description: The Marshal of the Third Cave shall not want for adequate defence.

title: Dailai Dongzhu's Armour
description: Suitable protections for the bold brother, descended of fire.

title: Dongtuna's Armour
description: Armour fitting for the Lord of the Second Cave.

title: Jinhuansanjie's Armour
description: The brave and the bold could endure many blows in such armour!

title: King Duosi's Armour
description: Duosi; the wisest, and perhaps best protected of all the Nanman.

title: King Meng Huo's Armour
description: For he who would be king of the tribes, only the most resplendent array.

title: King Mulu's Armour
description: Mulu communes with nature, and is armoured through its benevolence.

title: King Shamoke's Armour
description: The perfect weight and fit, tailored for this warrior of class and distinction.

title: King Wutugu's Armour
description: The King of the Caves shall have armour as strong as the mountain walls.

title: Lady Zhurong's Armour
description: Zhurong is protected by fire, her armour being just as scorching to attackers.

title: Mangyachang's Armour
description: A dependable lieutenant of the Nanman, clad in similarly dependable attire.

title: Common Tribal Armour
description: Adequate protection for the many battles of the tribes.

title: Exceptional Tribal Armour
description: Uncommonly excellent armour, made to endure a war, and then beyond.

title: Refined Tribal Armour
description: Beyond what most warriors will ever see, this armour is a testament to its creator.

title: Unique Tribal Armour
description: To call this armour a work of art would be to do a disservice to its individual brilliance.

title: Meng Jie's Armour
description: Armour of a more refined nature, for one who considers themselves more refined…

title: Meng You's Armour
description: These protections capture the boldness, the fire, and the naivety of youth.

title: Tu An's Armour
description: To the eternal victor go the rightful armours of war!

title: Xi Ni's Armour
description: For the one who routs enemies beyond counting, only the best will do.

title: Yang Feng's Armour
description: Good armour deceives as well as protects; hidden defences amongst the folds.

title: Shaman
description: Versed in the laws of the southlands, the shaman can find the things which others fail to see.

title: Representationist
description: To communicate between the tribes of the south, one must speak not one, but many languages.

title: Elephant
description: A proud pachyderm; brutal and imposing to all before it.

title: Monarchial Elephant
description: A majestic beast, fit for a true leader.

title: War Elephant
description: Bred for one purpose and one alone: to destroy its master's foes.

title: Southern Elephant
description: With a defiant trumpet and thundering feet, the elephant crushes all beneath vast feet..

title: Mountain Sunder
description: "Rock, armour, bone. All split, shatter and break."

title: Stone Axe
description: Stone may seem less refined than iron, but be assured it will still do the job.

title: Red Wind
description: Gifted from King Duosi in friendship

title: Burning Mace
description: Warning: Keep away from fire.

title: Machete
description: The machete serves a versatile purpose. It is good for cutting down both thicket and warrior alike.

title: Twin-flint Weapons
description: Flint casts a distinctive, alluring vision – not that it matters when embedding in someone's skull.

title: King Wutugu's Two-handed Axe
description: They say a weapon needs a name, but why? Would that make it more deadly?

title: Li Ru's Armour
description: The perfect weight and fit, tailored for this warrior of class and distinction.

title: Wei Yan's Armour
description: The perfect weight and fit, tailored for this warrior of class and distinction.

title: Xun You's Armour
description: The perfect weight and fit, tailored for this warrior of class and distinction.

title: Marshall of the Third Cave
description: From hidden spots and concealed ambushes, the strikes rise furiously from the earth.

title: Lord of the Mountains
description: Ahuinan will summon the very valleys to war against invaders, tearing apart the earth in his rage.

title: Chief of the Three Ravines
description: Where the power of the valleys meet, there you will find Ahuinan, poised to direct that strength.

title: The Cunning Youth
description: A keen mind and an observant eye can decide battles before any order is spoken.

title: The Brother of Flames
description: To live in the shadow of a powerful sibling is not so bad if you too are touched by greatness.

title: The Astute Tactician
description: Battlefield cunning may not guarantee victory, but it certainly does not hinder it.

title: Commander of the Left
description: Military fervour and ancestral zeal fuel a dedicated warrior!

title: The Distinguished Strength
description: One does not need to be the greatest warrior to prove their worth and their dedication.

title: The Enduring Mountain
description: No punishment can hold Dongtuna back, not even a hundred lashes of the rod upon his back.

title: Loyal Lieutenant
description: To them, their lord is everything - leader of all the tribes.

title: Guarder of the Path
description: The valleys are sacred, they are home; Jinhuansanjie would see them defended.

title: The Would-be Martyr
description: When every battle may be your last, there are no lengths to which you will not go.

title: The Superstitious Warrior
description: A life spent at war has given Duosi an overbearingly – he would say justified – distrusting temperament.

title: The Solitary Mountain
description: Duosi is as mighty as the highest peaks, but as reserved as the densest forest.

title: The Wisest Chief
description: What is there to know that Duosi does not already know?

title: The Stubborn Ox
description: What power Meng Huo has is born of physical prowess and ceaseless determination both.

title: The Ambitious Chieftain
description: If Meng Huo was not meant to reach for greatness, why give him the power to do so?

title: King of the Man
description: If there is another who could rule, they have yet to demonstrate a greater claim than Meng Huo.

title: The Mystic Lord
description: When the earth speaks, Mulu hears, then enacts nature's will.

title: The Enigma of the Valleys
description: Mulu is said to draw his strength from mystical, magic properties used to repel his enemies.

title: Chief of Bana Ravine
description: The chief of the ravine leads his warriors to war for his causes, as he sees fit.

title: Ruler of the Five Valleys
description: Shamoke brooks no resistance to his rule, showing mercy to his tribes and destruction to his enemies.

title: The Blood-Shot Lord
description: With his face aflame and his eyes cruor-red, Shamoke's presence strikes terror into all.

title: Sharp-minded
description: Despite his appearance, Shamoke is possessed of an inquisitive, incisive wit.

title: Wuguo Chieftain
description: Who could want a tame and comfortable land when one such as ours breeds the toughest warriors!?

title: Nanman Chieftain
description: Barbarians, some call us. A 'civilised' man who hasn’t the belly for a fight is no man at all!

title: Grand Chieftain
description: I have made the Nanman great – for to be a warrior there is no greater honour.

title: Irrepressible Fire
description: The inaction of so many others drives Zhurong ever, ever forward.

title: Received of the Cinder
description: The fires of ancestry smoulder within her – she will not see them snuffed out!

title: Descended of the Flames
description: Whether truly the kin of a goddess or not, Zhurong nevertheless fights with a super-human tenacity.

title: The Ready Ruler
description: A lifetime having the ear of leaders have positioned Mangyachang perfectly to ascend.

title: Peerless Commander
description: One does not achieve the title of second-in-command without proving martial prowess time and again.

title: The Loyal Subordinate
description: Mangyachang executes his leader's will with a zealous, ruthless efficiency.

title: Believer in Peace
description: Although we all tread the path of war, we must too believe in the paths of peace.

title: The Sophisticated Tribesmen
description: Does sacrificing one's ideals and ones ancestry make one learned? Perhaps!

title: The Learned One
description: Knowledge is not wisdom, and true intelligence is finding the points where they intersect…

title: Bull-headed Fighter
description: Meng You, once set upon a path, will invariably see it through to whatever conclusion.

title: The Little Warmaker
description: War comes as naturally as drawing breath to some.

title: The Dependable Sibling
description: For his tribe and his kin, Meng You will throw himself into the very jaws of death.

title: The Vicious Victor
description: Tu An will pursue his victory up to, and even past, the point of reason.

title: Eager Tactician
description: What victories Tu An earns, he will persist with and build upon.

title: War-Waiting General
description: Tu An is poised to fight, and eagerly awaits any and all opportunity.

title: The Relentless
description: You can be assured that Xi Ni will never give up, even if his pursuit leads to destruction.

title: The Waiting Warrior
description: Xi Ni is poised for war, and has been all his life.

title: The Stalwart
description: Some men are bred for war; Xi Ni is such a man.

title: Master of the Twenty-one Ravines
description: Yang Feng masters all he sees - and his sight is voracious indeed.

title: The Indulgent
description: Yang Feng is loyal to his tribe and his leader… until his own safety is jeopardised.

title: The Ever-reaching
description: Yang Feng has ambitions; desires he will see realised, one way or another.

title: Greedy

title: Honourable
description: A character of integrity and moral rectitude, who has rightfully earned the respect of others.

title: Humble
description: Like bamboo, the higher this individual grows, the deeper they bow.

title: Incompetent
description: Unable to cope with most situations, are there no limits to this one’s ineptitude?

title: Indecisive
description: Tends to dwell on all the possible options without ever actually committing to one.

title: Intimidating
description: A menacing individual, who stirs up awe and fear in all those in their presence.

title: Kind
description: A bit of fragrance always clings to the hand that gives roses.

title: Loyal
description: Like an unbreakable blade of grass in a tempest, this one’s loyalty has been proven in the most turbulent circumstances.

title: Modest
description: Deliberately unassuming in their words, actions, and manner.

title: Pacifist
description: The supreme art of war is to subdue an enemy without fighting.

title: Patient
description: One who endeavours to move a mountain begins by carrying away the smallest stones.

title: Perceptive
description: With near-superhuman observation skills, this individual is highly attuned to reading both situations and people.

title: Quiet
description: A conversation with this one is often a one-way affair. Frequently goes unnoticed in a room full of people.

title: Reckless
description: Would be the first to volunteer to extract a tooth from a tiger’s mouth.

title: Resourceful
description: Willing to bend instead of break.

title: Scholarly
description: For this individual, to study and learn is to attain treasures that cannot be lost or stolen.

title: Sincere
description: For every good reason to lie, this one will always find a better one to be honest.

title: Solitary
description: Totally at peace with themselves, they prefer their own company.

title: Stubborn
description: Whether or not they choose the correct path, little can detract them from it.

title: Superstitious
description: This one carries around a three-legged toad. Yes, really.

title: Suspicious
description: "The absence of evidence is not evidence of absence!"

title: Trusting
description: This one sees the good in people, even when there is none.

title: Unobservant
description: This one may have eyes, but more often than not, they cannot see.

title: Vain
description: The fly on the water buffalo’s back thinks itself better than the water buffalo himself.

title: Vengeful
description: Whenever wronged, this one emphatically repays their perceived injustices in kind, no matter how small.

title: Agile
description: A combination of speed, strength, and flexibility grants this individual the physical aptitude of an acrobat.

title: Beautiful
description: Turning heads wherever they go, the heavens have gifted this one with stunning looks.

title: Blind
description: Their life’s path has led them to lose their eyesight, but they bear it without misery.

title: Clumsy
description: Even when carrying out the most mundane tasks, they are like a bull in a china shop!

title: Co-ordinated
description: This person has an uncanny control of their limbs!

title: Decrepit
description: The years have not been kind to this individual, they are visibly the worse for wear.

title: Drunk
description: "He who drinks, dies. He who doesn't drink, dies as well."

title: Eunuch
description: Men without their manhood may still have a purpose.

title: Fat
description: Who ate all the rice?

title: Fertile
description: A most virile individual, this one’s bloodline is most definitely assured.

title: Graceful
description: Moves with the balletic grace of a butterfly.

title: Handsome
description: When one possesses aesthetic features so agreeable to the eye, shortcomings in personality or wealth matter little.

title: Healthy
description: A notable specimen of robust health and physical well-being.

title: Heartbroken
description: "Yes, hearts can break, but I think it would be better if we died when they did…"

title: Physically Ill
description: Stay away… this one’s contagious.

title: Infertile
description: This one has perhaps been kicked in the groin one too many times.

title: Lovestruck
description: Having recently become enamoured with another, this person is distant, distracted, and constantly daydreaming.

title: Lumbering
description: This one moves with the grace of an inebriated panda.

title: Mad
description: The lanterns are lit, but no-one’s home.

title: Maimed
description: "Quick, take my good hand!"

title: Lame
description: "I used to be a warrior like you…"

title: One-eyed
description: It’s hard to tell whether this character is winking or blinking…

title: Poxed
description: Covered in boils and pustules, heaven has cursed this individual to the life of a leper.

title: Scarred
description: These skin disfigurements are the remnants of a brutal and painful past.

title: Tiger General
description: One of the 'Five Tiger Generals of Shu', the most meritorious war leaders in the kingdom.

title: Sickly
description: The miracles of Hua Tuo himself could not heal this one of their constant afflictions.

title: Strong
description: This one is as strong as an ox.

title: Sui Knight
description: One of the formidable 'Knights of Han Sui', this warrior is not to be trifled with!

title: Tough
description: Tough times never last, but tough people generally do.

title: Weak
description: A gust of wind would blow this one right over. They are unsuited to any vocation that requires heavy lifting.

title: Elite General
description: One of the 'Five Elite Generals of Wei', the cream of all military commanders.

title: Clerk
description: Poverty keeps one honest.

title: Old Master
description: In a tranquil state, one can rule with no need for action.

title: General of Land

title: Great Teacher

title: General of the People

title: Hammer Spear
description: Devastating when it lands, ineffective if it misses.

title: Pole Mace
description: Imagine the force that can be generated by swinging a mace attached to a long pole.

title: Two-handed Mace
description: If you miss, you'll probably lose your footing; strike, and they are dead.

title: Headcrusher
description: "Death by the Headcrusher! Headcrusher!"

title: Chuí
description: To swing just one of these is a challenge, to carry both is a heroic feat.

title: Identical Chuí
description: Even their maker cannot tell them apart.

title: Matched Chuí
description: These twin maces are evenly matched.

title: Heavenly Bodies
description: Wrought from meteoric iron, these maces are as unstoppable as they are rare.

title: Gun
description: Even a traveller's walking staff can be a deadly weapon in the right hands.

title: Reinforced Gun
description: The wax-wood of this staff has been reinforced with metal, making a deadly weapon.

title: Balanced Gun
description: Tapering towards the end, this staff is perfectly balanced for combat.

title: Gun of Purity
description: Only a warrior untainted by corruption may wield a staff of such perfection.

title: Astrologer
description: The movement of the celestial bodies are there to guide us; this one has the talent to interpret them.

title: Monk
description: This one has given themselves fully to the Way, to become enlightened and to enlighten others.

title: Philosopher
description: This person understands that all knowledge is a stepping stone to greater questions and is unafraid to grapple with the unknown.

title: Sorcerer
description: It is whispered that this one can talk with the spirits to call upon their powers to heal, or if angered, curse others.

title: Writer
description: A good writer keeps things clear and succinct.

title: Brewer
description: China has many noble professions, but this person has chosen the noblest: to quench people’s thirst with beer.

title: Builder
description: Realising a building not only requires the technical skill to build, but the imagination to envision and design it.

title: Farmer
description: When life’s chaos threatens to overwhelm, this one takes to the field to clear their mind by working the land.

title: Jade Carver
description: Years of practice have given this one the precision and patience needed to carve jade.

title: Potter
description: "I have everything - large bowls, small bowls, tiny bowls. A cup? Are you sure you wouldn’t rather have a nice bowl instead?"

title: Advisor
description: This person possesses one of those invaluable minds that can quickly understand facts and consider the possibilities from all angles.

title: Singer
description: When this one sings, they manage to carry the original intention of the music while imbuing it with something new.

title: Fortune-teller
description: "I can tell you your future, but I cannot guarantee whether or not you will be glad of what you hear."

title: Musician
description: When this one plays, the world pauses for a short while to listen.

title: Physician
description: When someone falls ill, they call on this person to unblock their Qi and restore balance.

title: Follower
description: This one sympathises with the Yellow Turban cause and does their best to adhere to its ideals.

title: Pupil
description: This person has begun studying the Tao to educate themselves properly in the Way.

title: Student
description: This one has sought out a teacher to instruct them in the Tao and to help them reach enlightenment.

title: Academic
description: This person has completed the preliminaries of the Tao and has moved onto more difficult interpretations.

title: Attendant
description: This one has become an attendant to aid a Taoist teacher and to improve their own understanding of the Way.

title: Devoted Student
description: Realising that the Tao is all, this one has forsaken all else to give their life to following and preaching the Way.

title: Enlightened Student
description: Inspired by a great teacher, this person has decided to follow their path and become one themselves.

title: Xian
description: Ultimate wisdom is accepting that, as your knowledge grows, deeper mysteries will open up before you.

title: Yellow Sky Emperor
description: Our leader declared themselves emperor. They have enacted many military reforms and made us significantly more powerful.

title: Gracious
description: This person performs acts of compassion far beyond what is expected of mere etiquette, proving that their heart and deeds are genuine.

title: Kind-hearted
description: Respect earned from kindness has deep roots, whereas that forced from fear lives on shifting sands.

title: Bright
description: This person can find a use for things others would discard without thinking, so nothing is wasted.

title: Creative
description: When a problem confounds other more practically-minded people, this one applies imagination and innovation to find the answer.

title: Honest
description: This one believes that to be rich and powerful at the expense of their soul is a fool’s deal, and unworthy of consideration.

title: Selfless
description: By putting others before themselves, this one achieves peace and humility, acting as an example to us all.

title: Tolerant
description: This one affects ignorance to small misdemeanours, as a little dipping into the pot every now and then keeps the peace.

title: Tranquil
description: This one is as calm as a still lake; their thoughts possess a mindful clarity and they perform their tasks all the better for it.

title: Wise
description: When others are lost, it is this one’s advice they seek out first.

title: Vigilant
description: This one uncannily evades blows as if they are forewarned of each one.

title: Committed
description: Like an arrow, this one is ever-moving towards one goal, sweeping up many others in their wake.

title: Composed
description: Whenever tragedy strikes, this one remains untroubled and acts as an anchor for others with reason and clear thinking.

title: Intrepid
description: True courage comes from refusing to let fear paralyse you from righteous action, not in denying you feel it to save face.

title: Philanthropic
description: This person has few belongings and refuses luxuries to be free of material concerns and focus on the needs of others.

title: Formidable
description: "Show me a warrior that can match my strength and I shall exchange my sword and steed for a spade and plough!"

title: Fulfilled
description: Harmony comes from accepting things as they are; seeking change within the natural order instead of forcing it.

title: Cordial
description: Many speak highly of this person, for they are a pleasure to be around and conversation with them is effortless.

title: Cheerful
description: It is easy to be cynical, but this one remains open to beauty and hope and their optimism is infectious.

title: Concerned
description: This person is not content to simply nod sadly about other people’s troubles but goes out of their way to solve them.

title: Friendly
description: This one’s doors are always open, and the tea is always hot.

title: Populist
description: This shrewd individual anticipates and meets the wants of the people, even before they know them themselves!

title: Stern
description: An absolute belief in their own ideals as opposed to all others makes this person inflexible and lacking in sympathy.

title: Understanding
description: To help others without being sanctimonious and dismissing what may seem trivial demonstrates true empathy.

title: Relentless
description: When this one falls, he who strikes the final blow should dig the grave deeply, for some say even death will not stop them.

title: Uncomplicated
description: The Tao talks of the usefulness of empty spaces, but the vacuum between this person’s ears may be going too far.

title: Stalwart
description: Like a mountain, this one does not strive for greatness, but achieves it by simply being dependable to those that need them.

title: Obstinate
description: If told that everyone needed air to live, this person would hold their breath until they passed out.

title: Temperamental
description: Trying to predict this one’s moods is like trying to close shave with a sword, and every bit as unsettling.

title: Trustworthy
description: An open and honest face makes it easier to be places where you shouldn’t and hear confidences meant for other ears.

title: Spiteful
description: For this person the thrill of a vindictive word or deed as it hits home is as pleasing as a beautiful sunset.

title: Feared
description: A sword will cut one man down, but dread is like a fire that grows and spreads the more it consumes.

title: Healer of People
description: There is no way to protect everyone from harm, only to be on hand with compassion to heal them.

title: Impeccable
description: This person is fastidious in their appearance, demonstrating an attention to detail that inspires confidence in others.

title: Leader of People
description: The people need someone to unite them, and this one has the leadership  skills to do it.

title: Protector of People
description: This one recognises China as the people and does everything in their power to safeguard them.

title: Lame
description: The enemy that injured this 'valiant warrior' was a rock that tripped them as they fled the battle. More of a pebble, in fact.

title: Festering Wound
description: "When a man bleeds, it’s just tissue."

title: Healed

title: Battle Wound
description: A war injury still vexes this person when the seasons turn bitter, and may still cause further misery for them.

title: Unyielding Scale Mail
description: Not much to look at, but it's got it where it matters.

title: Dragon's Scales
description: Plates so resistant you would think them the hide of a winged-beast.

title: Redoubtable Mail
description: This armour is an extension of the self; defence flows through it, to the wearer.

title: Nature's Shield
description: It would be easier to split the very ground than this armour.

title: Thick Leather Hide
description: This armour is as a second skin, although considerably firmer.

title: Skin of the Peach Tree
description: Longevity is granted to those who offer devotion to the blossoms.

title: Proficient's Scale Mail
description: Hardened over years of use and experience, like its wearer.

title: Spirit of the Dog
description: "Dignity and understanding, friend. That is how we win."

title: Armour of the Adept
description: Functional, but masterfully-forged armour for the warrior of renown.

title: Enduring Tortoise
description: Hardened shell to defend against man, nature and heaven.

title: The Boistrous Cricket
description: Possessed of the same alacrity and fighting-joy as its namesake.

title: Raiments of War
description: Provides the wearer ample defence and a preternatural disposition for conflict.

title: Sage's Armour

title: Words of the Master
description: Passed down through generations, you embody their words now.

title: Forest Skin

title: The Forest Crane

title: Intellectual Vestures

title: Robes of the Mantis
description: "There is mystery in the way it moves, and beauty too."

description: A magnificent weapon, this spear truly embodies the integrity of its bearer.
